to state officially that a law, rule, etc. no longer has legal force: Previous efforts to repeal the law have failed. The state estimates about $41 million will be lost each year if the food tax is repealed.
the act of stating officially that a law, rule, etc. no longer has legal force: a repeal of sth The governor lobbied for repeal of the death penalty. They want to make sure their cashflow will be unaffected before they decide to back a repeal.
